newsitem.title: UK: HSBC James Capel raises year-end FTSE forecast.
newsitem.headline: HSBC James Capel raises year-end FTSE forecast.

text.p: HSBC James Capel on Monday raised its year-end target for the FTSE 100 index to 4,800 from 4,400 after the new government's measures last week to give the central bank greater freedom to set interest rate policy.
"The main reason was the independence of the Bank of England, announced last week," UK equity strategist Robert Buckland said.

"It has knocked 50 basis points off our gilt forecast, and we have also factored in a relatively cautious outlook on the relationship between equities and gilts because of some concerns about a change in the dividend taxation regime."
